profile.name: Tan Jun Lin
profile.title: Computer Science (Intelligent Computing) Graduate
profile.bio: Versatile Computer Science graduate specializing in Intelligent Computing and AI. Strong in full‑stack development (Flask, React.js, PHP) and machine learning (TensorFlow, transfer learning, CNNs). Experienced building data‑driven systems, IoT solutions and production dashboards; eager to contribute technical skills in applied AI and software engineering roles.

contact.address: 1367, Jalan Selasih 4, Taman Selasih, 09000 Kulim, Kedah

summary: Computer Science graduate (Intelligent Computing) with hands‑on experience in AI/ML (TensorFlow, OpenCV), full‑stack web apps (Flask, React.js, PHP), IoT systems and production dashboards. Proven record building and deploying engagement-detection and edge/cloud solutions, plus production-support tooling in R&D environments.

education.degree: Bachelor in Computer Science (Intelligent Computing) with Honours

highlights.title: AI-Driven Student Participation Tracker (Final Year Project)
description_points: Developed an AI-based system to track student participation and engagement during virtual classes.
Trained and fine-tuned a CNN using transfer learning on the DAiSEE dataset to classify engagement levels.
Integrated a face detection module to extract facial features for improved recognition accuracy.
Built a Flask backend and React frontend to present real-time participation metrics and classroom analytics.
Implemented data preprocessing, augmentation and evaluation pipelines to improve generalization and monitor model performance.
Focused on maintainable full-stack architecture and UX for instructors to view live feedback.

highlights.title: IoT-Based Smart Aquaculture System with AI-Driven Leaf Detection
description_points: Designed and implemented an IoT monitoring system using soil moisture sensors, DHT11 and actuators for automated irrigation.
Integrated a pre-trained CNN to detect plant health states (healthy, powdery, rust) and trigger alerts.
Implemented edge processing using Maker Feather AIoT S3 to run inference locally and reduce latency.
Transmitted sensor and inference data via MQTT to V-ONE Cloud and built dashboards for real-time visualization and alerts.
Enabled actuator control for irrigation scheduling and automated alerts for abnormal conditions.

project.title: eLD Lapor Diri (New Staff Registration System)
project.description: Implemented a web-based staff registration system (PHP, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery) to automate onboarding. Replaced handwritten forms with digital workflows to improve accuracy, accessibility and processing time; developed responsive front-end and PHP backend connected to MySQL.

responsibilities: Enhanced Modbus Digital Air Leak Tester application to improve system stability and reliability over previous versions.
Contributed to development of MAI Tracking System and Document Compilation Tools to streamline production workflows and reduce manual effort.
Participated in AI MAI project to automate Manufacturing Assembly Instructions (MAI) using AI techniques.
Developed PFMEA dashboard and Power Platform automation (Power BI / Power Automate) to support production risk assessment and decision-making.
achievements: Delivered dashboards and automation that improved visibility and reduced time for risk assessment.
Improved application reliability for mechanical testing tools.

responsibilities: Designed and implemented four in-house web applications (PHP, MySQL, HTML, CSS, JavaScript) for claims management, lunch ordering, COVID tracking and internal tools.
Managed company servers and databases, handled backups and basic administration to ensure uptime.
Gathered requirements, produced system flows and documentation; implemented front-end and back-end features.
achievements: Delivered multiple internal systems that improved operational efficiency and record-keeping.

responsibilities: Assisted customers in product selection and order processing.
Packed and ensured products were in good condition for delivery.
Managed online orders and basic customer service tasks.

projects.title: AI-Driven Student Participation Tracker
projects.description: Full-stack engagement detection system that uses transfer-learning CNNs to classify student engagement levels from classroom video frames. Implemented face detection to extract facial features and fused those with CNN outputs to increase recognition accuracy. Built REST APIs in Flask, a React frontend for instructors, and created evaluation pipelines for model fine-tuning. Emphasis on reproducible training, model monitoring and UX for real-time classroom feedback.
notes: Used transfer learning to adapt pre-trained CNN weights for engagement classification.
Implemented data pre-processing pipelines and augmentation to improve generalization.
Provided performance metrics and user-facing visualizations for instructors.

projects.title: IoT-Based Smart Aquaculture / Leaf Detection System
projects.description: End-to-end IoT solution for environmental monitoring and automated irrigation. Collected sensor data (soil moisture, DHT11) via Arduino devices, transmitted via MQTT, performed edge inference using a pre-trained CNN to detect plant health, and presented results on a V-ONE cloud dashboard. Implemented actuator control for irrigation and alerting for abnormal conditions.
notes: Designed edge compute pipeline to reduce latency and network dependency.
Integrated cloud dashboard for real-time visualization and alerts.
Improved irrigation scheduling and reduced manual supervision needs.

projects.title: In-house Web Systems (Inno Instrument)
projects.description: Developed multiple internal applications such as a claims management system, staff lunch ordering and a COVID test tracking tool. Responsible for requirements gathering, UI implementation, server-side logic and database integration to automate manual processes.
notes: Improved data accuracy and processing time for internal administrative tasks.
Deployed systems on company servers and maintained databases.
